timeline.message: Adding test for introspectVersion property addition
Add introspect watch domain to operator namespace
Modify the introspectVersion field to be a string
Add a check for introspect pod
Add a check for rolling restart
Call the WLST script with new properties to change the admin server port
Assign a unique name for every WLST execute job
Split the rolling into a separate test
Fix domain space in while gettiong admin port
change admin server and ms names
Added assertion to verify updated admin port

timeline.bodyText: Will the Job fail if the corresponding WLST script fails ?
timeline.author: anpanigr

replies.bodyText:
Yes if there are any exceptions or cannot connect to the admin server the job will fail.
Of course whoever calling this utility by supplying py script will have to make sure that they exit the WLST script with exit code 1 when something goes wrong.
replies.author: sankarpn

timeline.bodyText: Can I get the standout of the WLST script after the Job is complected ?  May be thru job log or some other mechanism
timeline.author: anpanigr

replies.bodyText: I  am printing it when job is done executing, so you don't need to look for it under diagnostic_logs. It will be available in console log itself.
replies.author: sankarpn

timeline.bodyText:
For a dynamic config.xml change (e.g. changing  cluster size) updating the introSpectVersion will initiate a simultaneous re-start.
For a non-dynamic config.xml change (e.g. changing  admin server port ) updating the introSpectVersion will initiate a rolling re-start.
Is this assumption is true ?
timeline.author: anpanigr

replies.bodyText: I don't think so. As far as I know, the re-introspect behavior is the same with either type of change, and an introspectVersion change is not expected to trigger a roll.  @russgold ^^^
replies.author: tbarnes-us

replies.bodyText:
For a dynamic config.xml change (e.g. changing cluster size) updating the introSpectVersion will initiate

It will only start the new pod if replica is also changed, won't restart existing pods
replies.author: sankarpn

timeline.bodyText:
Here we can use the logic used in TestActions.patchDomainResourceWithNewRestartVersion to dynamically generate the introspectVersion string, instead of hard-coding.
This utility can be moved to TestActions class as patchDomainResourceWithNewIntrospectVersion
timeline.author: anpanigr

timeline.bodyText: Description should be read as  "Verifies the introspector runs and pods are restated in a rolling  fashion"
timeline.author: anpanigr

timeline.bodyText: Should we have a test to just update the introSpectVersion with out any config change.
timeline.author: anpanigr

replies.bodyText: we can but what is the purpose of it?
replies.author: sankarpn

timeline.message:
Refactored the code.
Moved the introspectVersion tests to a separate file
Adding additional action methods to add labels to a existing namespace
Print job log of WLST even for success case
Patch the domain to increase the replicas size

timeline.bodyText:
do we really need this? if the domain shutdown fails for some reason, the test will be marked as failed which is not correct ...if its really needed, this should be done in afterEach or afterAll methods or without assert IMO.
Also domain custom resource is deleted as part of cleanup test infra, all the pods will be deleted as the Operator is still up at that time?
timeline.author: vanajamukkara

replies.bodyText:
Initially I added the tests in ItDominInPV.java and these tests were running after the first 2 which created 4 server pods. In order not to strain the cluster I thought of shutting down the domain before the introspectVersion test runs.
Since the introspectVersion tests are moved to a different class I removed these shutdown calls.
replies.author: sankarpn

timeline.author: vanajamukkara
vanajamukkara

revised_code.chunk:
diff --git a/new-integration-tests/src/test/java/oracle/weblogic/kubernetes/ItIntrospectVersion.java b/new-integration-tests/src/test/java/oracle/weblogic/kubernetes/ItIntrospectVersion.java
index 1a96cfb949..591f9e28aa 100644
--- a/new-integration-tests/src/test/java/oracle/weblogic/kubernetes/ItIntrospectVersion.java
+++ b/new-integration-tests/src/test/java/oracle/weblogic/kubernetes/ItIntrospectVersion.java

@@ -378,7 +378,7 @@ public class ItIntrospectVersion implements LoggedTest {
     // patch the domain to increase the replicas of the cluster
     StringBuffer patchStr = new StringBuffer("[{")
         .append("\"op\": \"replace\", ")
-        .append("\"path\": \"/spec/clusters[0]/replicas\", ")
+        .append("\"path\": \"/spec/clusters/0/replicas\", ")
         .append("\"value\": \"3")
         .append("\"}]");

timeline.message: Patch the domain with new replicas count and introspectVersion in one go
Add patch domain with introspect version after online WLST changes
Use node port for accessing application

timeline.bodyText: I think this will be fine, but I'm wondering if we can eventually do better... What I mean is that this could fail in two different ways: 1) unlikely -- but the introspector could run very fast and the test would miss that the pod ever existed, and 2) the introspector could run but fail quickly and similarly be missed. Let's see if this test starts to fail intermittently.
timeline.author: rjeberhard

replies.bodyText:
Yes I agree when I was manually testing it I missed the introspector lifecycle and noticed that within 30 seconds it finished running.
The withStandardRetryPolicy has a poll delay of 2 seconds so hopefully it shouldn't miss it. But lets see if fails intermittently.
replies.author: sankarpn

timeline.author: rjeberhard
